Ron -- a subject close to my heart!  I have found little to no 
information=
 offering any comparisons of work.  What I have found most 
helpful are the=
 following:
'Tosogu no Kigan' by Sasano;  does have some analysis/compariso=
ns
'Mito Koromono Shu' by Ikeda;  great pictures with his attributions
'Ko =
Kogai' by Ikeda;  I've never seen it but it is the best by report
also chec=
k this site out:  
http://touken-tousougu.hp.infoseek.co.jp/index.html
go t=
o the left hand column and you will see 2 through 8 in Japanese.
There are =
several great kogai in the fittings sections.
If you have any specific ques=
tions post them and perhaps we can get a 
discussion going.  (Gordon has a =
wonderful Ko Mino collection).
Pete Klein
